people.snippet:
Dr Stephanie Rap is assistant professor in children’s rights, Department of Child Law,
Leiden University Law School, the Netherlands. She holds an MSc in pedagogical
sciences, an MA in criminology (cum laude) and a PhD from Utrecht University. Her
academic interest lies in the field of the effective participation of children in (legal)
procedures, such as in juvenile justice, child care and protection, asylum procedures
and in schools, employing an interdisciplinary research approach. In 2017, she
obtained a grant from the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO)
to conduct a three-year study on the participation of refugee children in asylum
procedures in the Netherlands. She has published and presented widely on juvenile
justice, children’s rights and child participation. She lectures in the LLM programme
Advanced Studies in International Children’s Rights on topics related to juvenile
justice, child victims and child protection.

highlights.text: to the Handbook on European law relating to the rights of the child 2015 andco-led the worldwide consultation with children for the UN Global Study on ChildrenDeprived of Liberty. She teaches International Childrens Rights and Juvenile Justiceon the LLM Childrens Rights and Family Law at UCC.
